question_text_raw:
News about politics and current affairs, watching, reading or listening, in minutes
ASK ALL
On a typical day, about how much time do you spend watching, reading or listening to news about politics and current affairs?
Please give your answer in hours and minutes. 
INTERVIEWER: If no time spent, enter 00 00. 
TYPE IN DURATION
question_cleaned: On a typical day, how much time do you spend watching, reading, or listening to news about politics and current affairs? Please give your answer in hours and minutes (if none, enter 00 00).
notes: Removed interviewer/administrative wording and asterisks from labels. Preserves special nonresponse codes. The main responses are recorded as durations in hours and minutes (hh mm) which are not enumerated here.

question_text_raw:
Internet use, how often
CARD 1
People can use the internet on different devices such as computers, tablets and smartphones. How often do you use the internet on these or any other devices, whether for work or personal use?
question_cleaned: How often do you use the internet on any device (for work or personal use)?
notes: Removed 'CARD 1' and brief introductory phrase; rephrased as a direct question. Removed asterisks from special-code labels.

question_text_raw:
Internet use, how much time on typical day, in minutes
ASK IF MOST DAYS OR EVERY DAY AT A2 (IF A2 = 4, 5)
On a typical day, about how much time do you spend using the internet on a computer, tablet, smartphone or other device, whether for work or personal use?
Please give your answer in hours and minutes. 
INTERVIEWER: TYPE IN DURATION
question_cleaned: On a typical day, how much time do you spend using the internet on a computer, tablet, smartphone, or other device? Please answer in hours and minutes.
notes: Removed routing note and interviewer instructions (e.g., 'ASK IF...' and 'INTERVIEWER: TYPE IN DURATION'). Rephrased into a direct question asking for duration in hours and minutes. Preserved original special codes for non-substantive responses.

question_text_raw:
Most people can be trusted or you can't be too careful
ASK ALL 
CARD 2
Using this card, generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted, or that you can't be too careful in dealing with people? Please tell me on a score of 0 to 10, where 0 means you can't be too careful and 10 means that most people can be trusted.
question_cleaned: Generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted, or that you can't be too careful in dealing with people? Please answer on a scale from 0 to 10 where 0 means you can't be too careful and 10 means most people can be trusted.
notes: Removed card/interviewer instructions. Collapsed 11-point (0–10) scale into 5 ordinal categories (0–1, 2–3, 4–6, 7–8, 9–10). Simplified missing-code labels (removed asterisks).

Administration of how important things are for democracy
[For question D28, we are including five different versions with the order of the response items rotated by one position each time. The filter variable for this (D28Order) is described below. Each respondent should be randomly assigned to one of the five versions. There are also five different showcards for these items to reflect the different orders.

Create random split variable D28Order which will NOT BE SHOWN to respondents. Each experimental group should include approximately 20% of respondents. This variable should be populated at the start of the interview.

It is also required to build in CAPI hard checks at D28CheckA/B/C/D/E. At each of these, interviewers must be asked to confirm that the correct showcard is being used before they are allowed to progress to the next question.]
RECORD OUTCOME OF CAPI RANDOMISATION

question_text_raw:
Employment relation
INTERVIEWER: If respondent currently in work, F21 to F34a refer to their current job; if not in paid work but had a job in the past, F21 to F34a refer to their last job.
INTERVIEWER: If the respondent has more than one job, they should answer about the one which occupies them for the most hours per week. If they have two jobs that are exactly equal, they should answer about the more highly paid of the two.
ASK IF IN PAID WORK AT F17a OR F18, OR NOT IN PAID WORK BUT HAD A JOB IN THE PAST AT F19 (IF 01 AT F17a OR F18 = 1 OR F19 = 1)
In your main job {are/were} you...
READ OUT...

notes: Removed interviewer instructions and routing (question originally referred to current job or last job if not currently employed); reworded into direct question and removed asterisks from response labels.

question_text_raw:

READ OUT...

question_text_raw:
Allowed to decide how daily work is organised

READ OUT...

question_text_raw:
Allowed to influence policy decisions about activities of organisation

READ OUT...

ASK IF CURRENTLY IN PAID WORK AT F17a OR F18 (IF 01 AT F17a OR F18 = 1)
CARD 75
If you have a line manager, how much does he or she support employees in balancing work and personal commitments?
Please choose a number from 0 to 10, where 0 means not at all and 10 means completely.
INTERVIEWER: Line manager refers to the person the respondent receives work instructions from on a regular basis; if the respondent has several line managers, ask them to think of the one they received work instructions from most recently. This applies to all questions referring to the respondent’s line manager in this module.

values_raw.55: I don't have a line manager

question_cleaned: If you have a line manager, how much does he or she support employees in balancing work and personal commitments? Please answer on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 10 (completely).

adjusted_values.55: I don't have a line manager

notes: Removed routing, card and interviewer instructions (including line manager definition). Collapsed 11-point (0–10) scale into 5 categories mapping contiguous code ranges to descriptive labels. Preserved original special codes.

question_text_raw:
Speak with people you work with in person, how often compared with before COVID-19
ASK IF RESPONDENT DID NOT REPORT HAVING NO LINE MANAGER AT G44 AND NO COLLEAGUES AT G53 (IF G44 = 00, 01, 02, 03, 04, 05, 06, 07, 08, 09, 10, 77, 88 OR IF G53 = 01, 02, 03, 04, 05, 06, 07, 77, 88) 
For the next few questions, please think about all the people you work with, regardless of whether they are your line manager or your colleagues.
Now think about occasions where you and {him/her} are physically in the same location. Compared with before the coronavirus pandemic, would you say that you speak with {him/her} in person...
READ OUT...

question_text_raw:
